ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
geos:
- 3.14.1
numpy:
- '2'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
- 3.11.* *_cpython
- 3.12.* *_cpython
- 3.13.* *_cp313
- 3.14.* *_cp314
python_impl:
- cpython
python_min:
- '3.10'
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version

about.summary: Split feedstock for basemap

about.description:
Basemap toolkit is a library for plotting 2D data on maps in Python.
It is similar in functionality to the matlab mapping toolbox,
the IDL mapping facilities, GrADS, or the Generic Mapping Tools.
about.summary: Plot data on map projections with matplotlib
Data assets for matplotlib basemap
High-resolution data assets for matplotlib basemap

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.0.0" %}
{% set build_number = 4 %}

{% set data_version = "2.0.0" %}
{% set data_build_number = 0 %}

{% set python_min = "3.9" %}

package:
  name: basemap-split
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/matplotlib/basemap/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 192ee1c63291d7d1af98fab798c45239ea27e6ca31041afa8c42c8b697e44596
  patches:
    - patches/fix_install_hires_instructions.patch
    # v2.0.0 does not define python 3.14 + numpy entry
    - patches/add_python314_numpy_to_pyproject.patch
    # v2.0.0 hard codes a python <3.14 dep in setup
    - patches/relax_setup_python_check.patch

build:
  number: {{ build_number }}

requirements:
  build:
    - m2-patch  # [win]
    - patch     # [not win]

outputs:

  - name: basemap
    version: {{ version }}
    # These scripts will delete `pyproject.toml`. Remove ASAP.
    script: build-basemap.sh  # [not win]
    script: bld-basemap.bat  # [win]
    build:
      number: {{ build_number }}
      skip: true  # [python_impl == 'pypy' or win32 or s390x]

    requirements:
      build:
        - python                              # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}  # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - cython                              # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - numpy                               # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - {{ stdlib("c") }}
        - {{ compiler('c') }}
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
      host:
        - python
        - pip
        - setuptools
        - wheel
        - cython
        - numpy
        - geos
        - pyproj
      run:
        - python
        - {{ pin_subpackage('basemap-data', min_pin='x.x', max_pin='x.x') }}
        - {{ pin_compatible('geos', min_pin='x.x.x', max_pin='x.x.x') }}
        - packaging >=20.5,<26.0
        - matplotlib-base >=3.4,<3.11
        - pyproj >=3.0,<3.8
        - pyshp >=2.0,<2.4
    test:
      imports:
        - mpl_toolkits.basemap
      requires:
        - pip
        - {{ pin_subpackage('basemap-data', min_pin='x.x', max_pin='x.x') }}
        - matplotlib-base >=3.4
      commands:
        # removed for now until upstream moves to 3.10
        # - pip check
        - python -c "from mpl_toolkits.basemap import Basemap"
        - python {{ RECIPE_DIR }}/run_test.py
    about:
      home: https://matplotlib.org/basemap
      license: MIT
      license_family: MIT
      license_file:
        - LICENSE
      summary: Plot data on map projections with matplotlib
      description: |
        Basemap toolkit is a library for plotting 2D data on maps in Python.
        It is similar in functionality to the matlab mapping toolbox,
        the IDL mapping facilities, GrADS, or the Generic Mapping Tools.
      dev_url: https://github.com/matplotlib/basemap
      doc_url: https://matplotlib.org/basemap/
      doc_source_url: https://github.com/matplotlib/basemap/blob/v{{ version }}/doc/source/index.rst

  - name: basemap-data
    version: {{ data_version }}
    script: build-basemap.sh  # [not win]
    script: bld-basemap.bat  # [win]
    build:
      number: {{ data_build_number }}
      string: "basemap_{{ data_build_number }}"
      noarch: python
    requirements:
      build:
        - python {{ python_min }}             # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}  # [build_platform != target_platform]
      host:
        - python {{ python_min }}
        - pip
        - setuptools
        - wheel
      run:
        - python >={{ python_min }}
    about:
      home: https://matplotlib.org/basemap
      license: LGPL-3.0-or-later
      license_family: LGPL
      license_file: data/basemap_data/COPYING.LESSER
      summary: Data assets for matplotlib basemap
      dev_url: https://github.com/matplotlib/basemap

  - name: basemap-data-hires
    version: {{ data_version }}
    script: build-basemap.sh  # [not win]
    script: bld-basemap.bat  # [win]
    build:
      number: {{ data_build_number }}
      string: "basemap_{{ data_build_number }}"
      noarch: python
    requirements:
      build:
        - python {{ python_min }}             # [build_platform != target_platform]
        - cross-python_{{ target_platform }}  # [build_platform != target_platform]
      host:
        - python {{ python_min }}
        - pip
        - setuptools
        - wheel
      run:
        - python >={{ python_min }}
        - {{ pin_subpackage('basemap-data', min_pin='x.x', max_pin='x.x') }}
    about:
      home: https://matplotlib.org/basemap
      license: LGPL-3.0-or-later
      license_family: LGPL
      license_file: data/basemap_data_hires/COPYING.LESSER
      summary: High-resolution data assets for matplotlib basemap
      dev_url: https://github.com/matplotlib/basemap

about:
  home: https://matplotlib.org/basemap
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  summary: Split feedstock for basemap
  license_file:
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - molinav
    - ocefpaf
    - ReimarBauer
    - beckermr
